Paragraph.Text: The offense of battery occurs when a person:

SubParagraph.Text: Actually and intentionally touches or strikes another person against the will of the other; or
Intentionally causes bodily harm to another person.

Paragraph.Text: Except as provided in subsection (2), a person who commits battery commits a misdemeanor of the first degree, punishable as provided in s. 775.082 or s. 775.083.

Subsection.Text: A person who has one prior conviction for battery, aggravated battery, or felony battery and who commits any second or subsequent battery commits a felony of the third degree, punishable as provided in s. 775.082, s. 775.083, or s. 775.084. For purposes of this subsection, “conviction” means a determination of guilt that is the result of a plea or a trial, regardless of whether adjudication is withheld or a plea of nolo contendere is entered.
